comment: She is one of he worst professors I have ever had. She is more focused on bragging about how much she knows instead of teaching her students in a way they can understand.

She doesn't explain things well, and confuses you by rambling about things that do not even matter.  She is not helpful, and doesn't seem concerned when you are struggling. All she cares about is getting through the material on time.  She only gives you one example and expects for you  to be a genius. Worst professor that I have ever had.

I am not sure were all this praises are coming from for this professor. She knows are stuff yes but has a very bad behavior especially when she spent a lot  of time talking nasty about students whom needed are advice or help. I was really turned off by the major since i took are class first.Bad mouthing students is just bad way to learn from her.

Dr. Hultquist is very helpful if you just ask.  She can seem intimidating, but if you just talk to her she is very easy going. She knows her stuff, and is very good at explaining confusing topics.  This class is loaded with information and she tries to make the class as interesting as possible.
She's amazing!

Very difficult class, but it is at a 4000 level...what do you expect.  You will know material extremely well if you really try in the class.  Never expected anything higher than a B, ended up acing two of her tests.  You just have to put forth the effort needed for a 4000 level class.

extremely helpful and nice but don't get on her bad side because she will shun you like a child does. Kinda silly at times but she's a great prof and knows her stuff. Don't miss class simply because she covers a lot and moves fast. I would recommend her for exercise physiology if you want to get into grad school. stay on her good side and your ok..

Her tests are VERY hard!! Study, study, study!! Memorize her notes for the tests, only use the text book as a back-up. Her tests are straight out of her notes. Answer every question thoroughly on the lab write-ups and you will do fine on those.

I thought she was very sweet, BUT she talks about students behind their backs.Gloats about her doctorate.It's very obnoxious.Complains about students who talk to her in an entitled tone probably because she does the same.IMHO, she needs to grow up.I was turned off from the major when she started bad mouthing students.Common trend among EHS profs...
This is a very hard class with very little As given. Must be willing to study very hard to get a good grade. She doesnt answer questions very well, and isnt always clear when explaining material.

I really enjoyed this class. The tests were hard yet at the end of the semester I was confident in what I knew about exercise physiology. During the semester she was very accessible and had no problem answering questions both during and after class. Dr. Hultquist works to provide her students with the foundaton for success in this major.

Incredible class! Incredible teacher! She works so hard to make class interesting and understandable. Also she  provides every available resource to help her students succeed. Although the class is hard, with a little bit of initiative, success is more than possible. For the students who says she's mean or unreachable, they are lazy and inaccurate!

She is difficult but you earn your grade. You actually learn info that will be used in later classes, so I dont advise going the easy way out with Buresh. She cares for the student. Go see her, talk to her, and she will help you! she cares for her students alot and has help numerous get GA posotion at UTK.

She warns from the first day that 4300 is tough with limited A's earned. She is exacting, fair and extremely consistent. She has a strong attention to detail and to earn an A, you need one too. The labs are interesting and easy points. Exams were hard but fair. The final was tough but tied the whole semester together in a unique way.

shes really easy as far as giving you activity points and extra credit and letting you do other labs than what the book says. and she doesnt use the book at all and makes the tests off of her power points.  the test are pretty easy. i would reccommend this class to anyone because you shoudl be able to make an A! It is a lot to do during the summer

Her test are straight forward though she has lots of essay questions & her grading is harsh. she's okay and explains things in detail if needed. Won't forget to brag about her fitness level:( carries herself around like she's the best thing since sliced bread....

Dr. Hultquist is a great teacher! She loves what she does and it shows! The class is challenging, but if you study you will do fine! The first test was the hardest for me because it was ALOT of material- But I definitely recommend her!
Loved the class and learned a lot.  It's obvious that she loves the material!

Dr. Hultquist is an awesome teacher! She loves what she teaches and she loves to see students learn. She is very easy to talk to and always willing to explain anything that you may not quite understand. Tests are not too hard, but cover the material that she covered in lecture. Definitely would recommend!

Too much material in the summer. It's a difficult class unless you're good in  science. She tells you in the beginning the number of A's she will give out and she doesn't round up even if you get an 89.9. The tests are difficult but not unfair. She is a fairly new professor and talks about herself a lot.
Great professor even though difficult material. Would definitely recommend if your goal is to learn the material. Studying is mandatory but worthwhile!
